page.title: 09EVENTS
page.content: THE HILL RACE WHICH TAKES PLACE ON BANK HOLIDAY MONDAY IS RUN FROM THE ROYAL OAK PUBLIC HOUSE TO THE TOP OF LIDLINGTON HILL AND BACK.THE HILL HAS A GRADIENT OF 10%.THIS IS FOLLOWED BY A GALA IN WHICH VILLAGE ORGANISATIONS RUN STALLS SIDESHOWS AND GAMES.ST. MARGARETS' CHURCH HOLD A FETE IN JUNE AND A BAZAAR IN NOVEMBER. THE METHODIST CHAPEL HOLD A MINI MARKET IN NOVEMBER AND THE SUNDAY SCHOOL PERFORM A NATIVITY PLAY AT CHRISTMAS. BOTH HOLD A HARVEST SUPPER FOLLOWED BY AN AUCTION OF PRODUCE AND GIFTS DONATED AT THE HARVEST FESTIVALS. THE GREEN MAN PUBLIC HOUSE ORGANISES THE BOG SEAT TROPHY,THIS IS AN ELIMINATION CONTEST OF DARTS,DOMINOES AND BAR BILLIARDS DURING 12 MONTHS.PRIZE IS A TOILET SEAT.A BONFIRE AND FIREWORKS DISPLAY IS HELD ON NOVEMBER 5TH. 1985 SAW THE REVIVAL OF FLOWER SHOW.
